verses.kjv: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.
verses.ct: Answer me when I cry out to you, God of my righteousness. You gave me relief when I was in trouble; show me mercy and listen to my prayer.

verses.kjv: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame? how long will ye love vanity, and seek after leasing? Selah.
verses.ct: People, how long will you drag my honor through the mud? How long will you chase after worthless things and pursue lies? Selah.

verses.kjv: But know that the LORD hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the LORD will hear when I call unto him.
verses.ct: Understand this: the LORD has set apart the faithful for himself. The LORD will listen when I call out to him.

verses.kjv: Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.
verses.ct: Tremble with reverence and do not sin. Search your own hearts as you lie on your beds, and be silent. Selah.

verses.kjv: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the LORD.
verses.ct: Bring offerings of righteousness and place your trust in the LORD.

verses.kjv: There be many that say, Who will shew us any good? LORD, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.
verses.ct: Many people ask, 'Who will show us anything good?' LORD, let your favor shine on us.

verses.kjv: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time that their corn and their wine increased.
verses.ct: You have filled my heart with more joy than others have when their grain and wine overflow.

verses.kjv: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, LORD, only makest me dwell in safety.
verses.ct: I will lie down and fall asleep in peace, because you alone, LORD, keep me safe.
